poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: Graf Morgen, Clermont, Sunday, Plots against us. Not like the officers of night Who hold as robbers heights they got as sycophants. Yet will he station coffee cup and croissant Like chessmen And smile at the telling gaffe. He won't give up Till we gaff him. He holds The sun should ever rise. But past the zenith - Into what? Plot a graph, Count: see it dwine. His Excellency, not unlike Catania, Rebuilt from what erased it Time and again.
